data: Patients with Medium Chain Acyl-CoA Dehydrogenase  (MCAD) Deficiency are at risk of acute metabolic crisis and hypoglycemic brain injury.  During illness patients may develop hypoglycemia, severe deterioration of general condition, alteration of sensorium (lethargy, coma), seizures, vomiting and refusal of feeding
Laboratory findings may indicate hypoketotic hypoglycemia, metabolic acidosis, high liver transaminases, creatine kinase and lactate dehydrogenase, hyperammonemia and elevated lactate
Do not order Pedialyteas this contains inadequate carbohydrate content
Provide meals / snacks q2h day and night
Provide meals / snacks q3h day and night
Avoid foods with MCT Oil, Coconut Oil and Coconut Milk
Avoid foods with MCT Oil, Coconut Oil and Coconut Milk

Continue IV Fluids if:  - POC Glucose Whole Blood less than 3.5 mmol/L  - If patient is normoglycemic but not able to tolerate oral intake  - If patient has diarrhea, vomiting, dehydration, abnormal labs, high fever
Calculate Pediatric Maintenance Fluids based on 4-2-1 Rule
2 mL/kg, IV, once, administer over: 30 minute, drug form: bag
2 mL/kg, IV, once, administer over: 10 minute, drug form: bag
2 mL/kg, IV, once, administer over: 20 minute, drug form: bag
10 mL/kg, IV, once, administer over: 30 minute, drug form: bag
20 mL/kg, IV, once, administer over: 30 minute, drug form: bag
10 mL/kg, IV, once, administer over: 60 minute, drug form: bag
20 mL/kg, IV, once, administer over: 60 minute, drug form: bag
See most recent TFI orders, IV, drug form: bag
KCL containing continuous infusions should only be started based on patients electrolytes and renal status
See most recent TFI orders, IV, drug form: bag
See most recent TFI orders, IV, drug form: bag
See most recent TFI orders, IV, drug form: bag
Do not administer IV lipids, proPOFol,  or acetylsalicylic acid
If patient is on levOCARNitine supplements, continue PO/IV as  tolerated
12.5 mg/kg, IV, q6h, drug form: inj
12.5 mg/kg, q6h, QID, drug form: oral liq
12.5 mg/kg, q6h, QID, drug form: tab
